conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze the motion of the electron through the particle accelerator using given figures and equations.
The image shows a schematic diagram of a particle accelerator with multiple metal cylinders numbered from 0 to 8, connected to poles of an AC power supply.
The electron starts from rest at the center of cylinder 0, connected to even-numbered cylinders.
At t = 0, the potential difference between odd and even cylinders is positive, accelerating the electron.
The electron enters cylinder 1, experiencing a uniform electric field E due to potential difference U.
The acceleration of the electron in cylinder 1 is a = eU/mT.
The velocity of the electron as it enters cylinder 1 is v1 = sqrt(2eUL1/mT).
The electron exits cylinder 1 and enters cylinder 2, experiencing the opposite electric field.
The electron is decelerated in cylinder 2, losing velocity until it exits.
The length Ln of each cylinder must be designed such that the electron maintains a constant velocity through the gaps.
The length Ln is determined by the condition that the time spent in each cylinder is negligible compared to acceleration and deceleration periods.
The length Ln is calculated based on acceleration and deceleration periods, ensuring constant velocity through gaps.
The length of the nth metal cylinder should be Ln = (mT/2eU)(v1^2/2).
